thread.title: UF Roundup: Oilers drop key match to Ferris St.
thread.title_full: UF Roundup: Oilers drop key match to Ferris St.

author: The Courier
title: UF Roundup: Oilers drop key match to Ferris St.
text:
Comment: 0 
BIG RAPIDS, Mich. — The University of Findlay dropped a 25-17, 25-20, 25-15 decision to Ferris State in a key Great Lakes Intercollegiate Athletic Conference volleyball match Friday night. Findlay dropped to 15-6 overall and 8-2 in the GLIAC with the loss. The Bulldogs improved to 21-1 and a perfect 10-0 in conference play. Amanda Winner led the way for the Oilers with nine kills and four digs. Hannah Tong (Carey) netted eight kills and Nickyla Garverick led Findlay with two blocks while also adding five kills. Hailee Olson dished out 21 assists. Becca Shoemaker added 14 digs. The Oilers return to action today with a 4 p.m. match at Grand Valley State. 
Men’s soccer blanked Northwood’s Kevin Levock scored all three goals to lead the Timberwolves to Friday’s 3-0 Great Lakes Intercollegiate Athletic Conference men’s soccer win over the University of Findlay at DeHaven Field. The Oilers slipped to 9-5-1 overall and 7-4-1 in the GLIAC. Northwood, the No. 8 team in the latest Division II coaches poll, improved to 13-11 and 11-1. Northwood had a 15-8 edge in shots as Findlay goalkeeper Ben Richter recorded six saves. Johannes Sterobo had one save for the Timberwolves. Findlay is back in action Sunday when it hosts Saginaw Valley State at noon. 
Women’s soccer falls The University of Findlay’s Marissa Swindell scored the only goal Friday as the Oilers dropped a 4-1 decision to Ashland in a Great Lakes Intercollegiate Athletic Conference women’s soccer match at DeHaven Field. Morgan Bittengle and Kaylee Ferguson scored to give the Eagles (12-2, 8-2 GLIAC) a 2-0 halftime lead. Bridget McEldowney and Caron Janssen added goals in a 23 second span of the second half to give Ashland a 4-0 cushion. Swindell’s goal, her fourth of the season, came with 7 minutes left. Findlay (1-11-3, 0-8-2) travels to Lake Erie for a 1 p.m. match on Sunday.
